author: JumpingYang001
body:
Try paste below script into PS console, it will shows 5 times, since I use latest code today, old build is OK.

```
Add-Type -TypeDefinition @"
    [System.Flags]
    public enum TestMeasureText : uint
    {
        TestIgnoreWS = 1,
        TestCharacter = 2,
        TestWord = 4,
        TestLine = 8
    }
"@
```

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: @JumpingYang001 What's the repro? I copied your code and pasted into v0.4.0 and it worked just like it does on Windows.

comments.author: JumpingYang001
comments.body:
surprise, when I paste into console it shows like below:

Below is my PSL version:

> PS /workspace/PowerShell> get-host

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: `get-host` isn't super useful. Can you post `apt-cache show powershell` and your environment?

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body:
I still can't repro this. I tried both inside and outside of Tmux, in Putty, with TERM set to both `putty-256color` and `ansi`. Nothing with my profile either.

``` sh
apt-cache show powershell
Package: powershell
Status: install ok installed
Priority: extra
Section: shells
Installed-Size: 66989
Maintainer: Andrew Schwartzmeyer <andschwa@microsoft.com>
Architecture: amd64
Version: 0.4.0-1
Depends: libunwind8, libicu52
Description: Open PowerShell on .NET Core
 PowerShell is an open-source, cross-platform, scripting language and rich object shell.
 Built upon .NET Core, it is also a C# REPL.
Description-md5: 3f697dcbf7996cf79ea253562f447dd2
License: Unlicensed
Vendor: Microsoft <mageng@microsoft.com>
Build-Depends: dotnet, cmake, g++
Homepage: https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell
```

comments.author: JumpingYang001
comments.body: It shows my Version: 0.2.0-1, but my local code is latest same as remote, what's wrong here?

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: You need to install the PowerShell package to update the one on your system. Building PowerShell from source does not install PowerShell. See https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases

title: When I paste multiple lines start and end with @ into PS console, it shows 5 times
